channel.title: How do I
channel.description: How do I change the skill cape emotes or the special attacks animations? I have a 317 Delta. The reason I want to change the skill cape emote is because one of them freezes the game. It's the same for the Dark Bow special. If anyone is kind enough to give me the emote ID of the skill capes it would be greatly appreciated.

item.title: How do I
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

deathschaos9:

Its possible, but its hard to dump the anim files.

correction, its not hard to dump the anims,(many people have done it already) its just hard to make the client load them.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I
item.dc:creator: @itai itai
item.description:
@itai wrote:

FOR SPECS:
First go into client class and look up the id until you find something like this.

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 667 && specialAmount > 99){ AttackingOn2.playerLevel[1] -= hitDiff; AttackingOn2.sendQuest("" + AttackingOn2.playerLevel[0] + "", 4004); AttackingOn2.sendQuest("" + AttackingOn2.playerLevel[1] + "", 4008); AttackingOn2.sendQuest("" + AttackingOn2.playerLevel[2] + "", 4006); AttackingOn2.sendQuest("" + AttackingOn2.playerLevel[4] + "", 4010); AttackingOn2.sendQuest("" + AttackingOn2.playerLevel[5] + "", 4012); AttackingOn2.sendQuest("" + AttackingOn2.playerLevel[6] + "", 4014); setAnimation(2927); specialAmount -= 100; lastSpecial = System.currentTimeMillis(); specGFX(654); hitDiff = 10 + misc.random(55); getHit(10); specOn = false; }
You see this, change the GFX id.

specGFX(654);

Then look it up again, you should find this.

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 667 && specialAmount > 99){ specialAtkNPC(false, 100, 600, 2927); hitDiff = 10 + misc.random(50); specGFX(654); }
Change this again.

specGFX(654);

Then compile.

For the skillcapes it is the same concept.

Read full topic
